greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest number with the prime signature of n using prime divisors of n.
comment: Though a large number of initial terms match, this sequence is different from A069799. Example: a(1500) = a(2^2*3*5^3) = 5^3*3^2*2 = 2250, whereas A069799(1500) = 5^2*3*2^3 = 600.
The first term that is different from A069799 is a(18). - _Ivan Neretin_, Jul 29 2015
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
program: a085079 n = product $ zipWith (^) (a027748_row n) (sort $ a124010_row n)
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Jul 01 2003
ext: Corrected and extended by _Ray Chandler_, Aug 17 2003
